result.execSummary:
The defendant David Allen Bautch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, Repeater [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid restitution converted to a civil judgment.

supervisions.notes: Defendant has 65 days sentence credit if revoked.  In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Restitution ordered: TBD; 10% Restitution surcharge.  6-13-2017:  Restitution Order signed by Judge Horne: R.K. - $7000.00; Restitution Surcharge - $700.00
Defendant to pay court costs and DNA surcharge.

Defendant not to possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant subject to random drug and alcohol testing.  Defendant not to possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Defendant is to have no contact with any individual using or trafficking controlled substances.  Defendant is to have no contact with R.K.
Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.  Defendant to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Sentence can be served on electronic monitoring.  6-26-2017 - per correspondence from Judge: Huber and EM are both approved.  6-29-2017 - per correspondence from Judge:  Defendant may serve in Clark County if arrangements can be made.  08-02-2017 - per correspondence from Judge:  Court approves modification to allow release on 09/01/2017

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution ordered.  Unpaid restitution is to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant to complete AODA Assessment and comply with all treatment recommendations.
Defendant is to have no contact with known users or traffickers of controlled substances.
Defendant is to submit to random testing to ensure sobriety.

Sentencing hearing on January 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Judge Horne appears by video conferencing.  Defendant David Allen Bautch in court with attorney Gina Frances Bosben.  Defendant in custody.  John Harrison Sacia appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant can hear and see Judge.  Defendant wishes to proceed with hearing via video.  Defendant wishes to enter plea.  Court advises defendant of rights, maximum penalties and elements.  Attorney Bosben believes defendant KVI waives rights. Defendant satisfied with representation.  Complaint used as factual basis. Court finds def KVI waives rights and accepts plea.  Court finds def guilty on count 1, counts 2-3 DRI.  PSI ordered.  Bond cont.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
